thread.title: Lady Bombers take fourth at state
thread.title_full: Lady Bombers take fourth at state

title: Lady Bombers take fourth at state
text:
Lady Bombers take fourth at state Bulletin Staff 11:29 p.m. CDT October 20, 2015 The Mountain Home doubles team of Maddy Lewis, left, and Cara Conner congratulate each other after a point during a recent match. The Lady Bombers finished in fourth place at the Class 6A State tennis tournament on Tuesday at Russellville. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) 19 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Mountain Home Lady Bomber tennis team lost three of its four matches it played on Tuesday but managed to take a fourth-place finish at the Class 6A State tennis tournament at Russellville. 
Mountain Home’s Cortni Thomas received a first-round bye and won her quarterfinal match Monday, 6-1, 6-0, to advance to Tuesday’s semifinals against Lake Hamilton’s Kami Ward. 
Thomas fell 1-6, 2-6 to Ward, but responded with a 6-1, 6-3 victory over Jonesboro’s Maggie Playter in the third-place match. Jonesboro’s Maddie McKee defeated Ward 6-1, 6-4 in the championship match. 
Jonesboro rolled to the team championship with 14 team points, while Little Rock Hall was second with seven, all earned by their championship doubles team. 
The Lady Bomber doubles team of Maddy Lewis and Cara Conner also received a first-round bye and won their quarterfinal match, 6-1, 6-0, on Monday. 
The duo fell 4-6, 1-6 to Little Rock Hall in the semifinals on Tuesday, and fell 4-6, 2-6 to Lake Hamilton’s Luna Lazovich and Elle Henson in the third-place match. 
The Hall team defeated Jonesboro’s top doubles team 6-3, 6-1 in the championship match. 
Lake Hamilton finished in third place with six team points, while Mountain Home was fourth with four points. 
Jonesboro cruised with 17 points to a boys’ team championship, even with its top singles player, Connor Mackey, falling in the championship match. 
Billy Beck, the lone Bomber to advance to state, won his first-round match over Texarkana’s Michael Blair, 6-1, 6-1, but fell 1-6, 0-6 to Mackey in the quarterfinals. Beck’s win gave the Bombers one team point. 19 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://www.baxterbulletin.com/story/sports/2015/10/20/lady-bombers-take-fourth-state/74286650/ TOP VIDEOS
